definition: to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy

sentences.english: This little snake had a tougher customer the other day in the bit of eternity it was trying to swallow.
sentences.chinese: 那天，这难缠家伙成为小蛇难以下咽的不朽片断。

sentences.english: A difficult boss can make your time at work miserable.
sentences.chinese: 一个难缠的上司会让你觉得在工作时度日如年。

sentences.english: There is more to managing difficult patients than relying on pharmacotherapy.
sentences.chinese: 应对难缠患者，药物治疗是不够的。

sentences.english: He was up against some pretty tough competition.
sentences.chinese: 当时他要面对不少非常难缠的竞争对手。

sentences.english: Tony Snow had to crea the some how to wander (two careers that somehow intertwined).
sentences.chinese: 托尼斯诺有二份十分难缠的事业。

sentences.english: It is usually husbands who crack the jokes about difficult, interfering mothers-in-law .
sentences.chinese: 女婿们常爱拿难缠多事的丈母娘开开玩笑。

sentences.english: He is a very difficult man to speak to, and Bruce's behavior is worsening.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位很难缠的人，普鲁斯的行为正在变坏。

sentences.english: You don't want to appear high-maintenance before being offered the position.
sentences.chinese: 在得到这份工作之前你不想表现得是个难缠的人吧。

sentences.english: Alright, alright, no need to be a bridezilla.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，好吧，你不应该成为一个难缠的新娘。

sentences.english: We're just having some cola before getting to the tough stuff--math.
sentences.chinese: 我们只是在对付难缠的数学之前先喝些可乐。

sentences.english: Toughs can have critters or terrors as pets or companions.
sentences.chinese: 强者可以有野生动物或难缠生物作为宠物或伙伴。

definition: not to be trifled with/not to be pushed around/stand no nonsense
to be afraid of the consequences/restraining fear
to handle/to deal with/to cope/to get by with
lit. to appear and disappear unpredictably like a spirit or a ghost (idiom)/fig. elusive
